mods.note: ■■■■■■■ Confidential. (C13/6/4/51) d) Political Agency, Bahrain, 13th February, 1951. Dear Residency, Your complimentary slip No. 407/3/50 of the 2nd January. 2* We enclose copies of letters exchanged between the Political Of ficer, Trucial Coast, and the Euler of Dubai. Yours ever, Agency. The Political Residency, Jufalr.0401/7/51. British Agency, Sharjah, 5th Feb. 1951. With the coapliaents of the Political Officer Trucial Coast Sharjah. ^ T-ncl: Copv of letter Wo. 0401/4/51 Dt. 14/1/51 from P.C.T.C. to the Ruler of Eubai, and copy of letter Et.20/1/51 from the Ruler of Dubai. Reference Bahrain Agency letter No .013/6/2/51 of the Sth Jan. 1951. MM Political Agency, Bahrain. (§)<$■■■■■■■■ Copy of letter dated the 20th January 1951 from Shaikh Said bin Maktum,0.B.E., Ruler of Dubai to Mr.H.D.Michell, Political Officer, Trucial Coast. After Compliments, I have received your letter of 14th January 1951 with pleasure and understood the contents. I therefore confirm the receipt of it. Usual ending.Anglo-Arabic. 0401/4/51. British Agency, Sharjah. 14th January, 1951. To: Shaikh Said bin Maktua, 0.3 , Ruler of Dubai. After Coiapliements, I wish to draw your attention, 0 Shaikh, to the Air Agreement made between you and Kis Majesty’s Government on July 22nd, 1938. 2. I am instructed to inform you that His Majesty’s Government no longer desire to renew this agreement beyond its present term, which expires on the 22nd July, 1951, and that it will lapse from this date. 3. I should be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter and signify that you understand its contents. Usual ending. Sd.H.D.Michell, Political Officer, Trucial Coast, Sharjah.\ ^> j (z>I j t> i Confidential. (C13/6/2/51) Political Agency, Bahrain, 8th January, 195QL Dear Michell, * Please refer to the correspondence^ ^ ending with Jackson's letter to me No.548.0425 of the 8th June, 1948, regarding the Dubai Air Agreement. 2. I now enclose a copy of Foreign Office despatch No.85 of the 6th December, 1950, and should be glad if you would inform the Ruler of Dubai that H.M.G. no longer desire to renew the Air Agreement beyond its present term; and Ifet me know his reply. Yours sincer 4y, 'i H.D. Michell, Esq., Political Officer (Trucial Coast), Sharjah. jTee ~ j ^ I S&_ ^ r. i28ioi 97* COIn^ iDEi'ITIAL 407 /. 3^0 tfOl/z/SV The Political Agent, Bahrain. ^v7. w WITH THE COMPLIMENTS OF HIS MAJESTY’S POLITICAL RESIDENCY For communication to the Ruler of Dubai and report. c/zs BRITISH RESIDENCY, BAHREIN, PERSIAN GULF. 2 nd January, 1951 « 37433-5FOREIGN OFFICE, S.W.1. 6th Deceniber, 195C. Bl. 85. (GA 35/H7) CONFIDEinTIAL With reference to Your Excellency’s confidential despatch No. 93 (61/53) of 21st June 1948 reporting the extension of the air agreement with the Shaikh of Dubai, His Majesty’s Government no longer desire to renew this agreement beyond its present term, which expires on 22nd July, 1951. The moorings for emer gency use by civil flying boats are no longer needed, and the Royal Air Force have no interest in facilities I am, with great truth and respect. Sir, Your Excellency’s obedient Servant, (For the Secretary of State) (Sgd.) W. Harpham. Lieutenant Colonel Sir Rupert Hay, K.G.I.E., C.S.I., Bahrain.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

The main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 10; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-9; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file comprises correspondence informing the Shaikh of Dubai (Saʻīd bin Maktūm Āl Maktūm) of the Foreign Office's decision not to renew the Dubai Civil Air Agreement, which was due to expire in July 1951.A series of file notes which were maintained as a record of the correspondence in the volume can be found at folio 2.
